summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganThe about-face Matte Fluid Eye Paint is a powerful, one-swipe punch of liquid eye color that delivers bold, buildable pigment.
details: DetailsBenefitsThe matte liquid formula swipes on easily for a smooth, no-budge, no-smudge finish.FeaturesAll about-face products are 100% veganItem 2599836How To UseFor a no-budge pop of color:Prep eyelids with Shadow Fix Eyeshadow Primer for a smooth canvas and long-lasting wear. Wait 20-30 seconds for formula to dry.Apply Matte Fluid Eye Paint to eyelids with fingers or your favorite tool for as much or as little as you're into. The canvas is yours!Want a little sparkle? Using your fingers or a brush, apply your favorite shade of Fractal Glitter Dust or Fractal Glitter Gelly on top of Matte Fluid Eye Paint.To wear as eyeliner:Gently tap (don't sweep!) the formula using a stamping motion on the lashline using an angled eyeliner brush.IngredientsIsododecane, microcrystalline wax, isodecyl neopentanoate, mica, trimethylsiloxysilicate, disteardimonium hectorite, dipentaerythrityltetrahydroxystearate/tetraisostearate, polyethylene, hydrogenated polycyclopentadiene, boron nitride, silica, propylene carbonate, silica dimethyl silylate, tocopherol, [may contain/peut contenir: blue 1 (CI 42090), iron oxides (CI 77499), iron oxides (CI 77492), titanium dioxide (CI 77891), iron oxides (CI 77491), ferric ferrocyanide (CI 77510), manganese violet (CI 77742), yellow 5 (CI 19140), ultramarines (CI 77007)].
how_to_use: For a no-budge pop of color:Prep eyelids with Shadow Fix Eyeshadow Primer for a smooth canvas and long-lasting wear. Wait 20-30 seconds for formula to dry.Apply Matte Fluid Eye Paint to eyelids with fingers or your favorite tool for as much or as little as you're into. The canvas is yours!Want a little sparkle? Using your fingers or a brush, apply your favorite shade of Fractal Glitter Dust or Fractal Glitter Gelly on top of Matte Fluid Eye Paint.To wear as eyeliner:Gently tap (don't sweep!) the formula using a stamping motion on the lashline using an angled eyeliner brush.

reviews.headline: It's ok
reviews.comments: It dries down very fast, it is good for graphic liner but using it all over your lid doesn't work. I tried it with eye primers, concealer, and other things to try to keep it from drying down and it still did. The shade of grey also wasn't as cool toned as I thought.

reviews.headline: Red
reviews.comments: I got the red one. It's a bit hard to blend and could be patchy but you should layer it if it looks patchy. The red one has an orange undertone which shows once blended out. It's beautiful and my favorite one.

reviews.headline: Do not like the texture in my lips
reviews.comments: The texture of this lipstick doesn't feel good in my lips. It's ok, not that bad but it's not smooth.

reviews.headline: Underrated
reviews.comments: Got this in the matte brown and was blown away. This is the liquid eyeshadow formula i needed. Perfect for one and done makeuo looks.  These are better than that another newly released high end. They blend better, dry down nicely.  We need more neutrals of this !

reviews.headline: Pretty
reviews.comments: Its really pretty but i am very disappointed my tube is empty. Nothing comes out ive scraped and scraped sides. I cant get barely anything out the tube. Im going to retrun and repurchase. Hopefully this one just a dud.

reviews.headline: It's literally red in a tube
reviews.comments: It blends well, it feels amazing to work with, you can mix it with a lipgloss and you can use it as a blush. I'll never need to look for a true red ANYTHING ever again.

reviews.headline: ABSOLUTELY AMAZINGG
reviews.comments: I bought this yesterday and to say I'm shocked by how amazing it is is a understatement I love it sm! I can't wait to buy more of this in the future

reviews.headline: AMAZING!!
reviews.comments: 10000000000000/10 so good and applys beautiful!! I got the black one :)

reviews.headline: I would buy this again
reviews.comments: We bought it for my daughter's dance competition. Very good color pigmentation and it stayed on really well.

reviews.headline: not for me
reviews.comments: So it glommed and kind of creased all over my lids, yes, i used primer.

reviews.headline: Favorite matte shadow
reviews.comments: Love the pigment of this product and it lasts all day.   My new favorite and I will be buying more colors!!!

reviews.headline: This shade Freaked is really beautiful!
reviews.comments: Really love this shade. It looks really good and stays in place!

reviews.headline: Very beautiful! !
reviews.comments: This is a beautiful shade! I like it more than I thought I would.

reviews.headline: Great liquid  eye paint. The color is vibrant
reviews.comments:
Make  sure you apply eye paint quickly and blend  quicky as it tends to set ( dry) quickly . Great price and love the tube it comes in .
This product comes in other vibrant colors that everyone can use .There should be more colors to choose from . I'm sold from this product

reviews.headline: Patchy, doesn't blend
reviews.comments: I have two colors of the fluid eye paint and neither of them blend out at all. They're extremely streaky, patchy and muddy.

reviews.headline: Very nice and creamy
reviews.comments: Goes on super smooth and has good pigment. Also very blendable.

reviews.headline: nice!!!
reviews.comments: THE opque pigment liquid eyeshadow, as far as I can find. absolutely stunning colors. some are better than others probably, but "replicant" and "blue monday" are absolutely killing it for me. you can build, blend, and spread the product too. a little goes a long way.

reviews.headline: Matte Eye Paint
reviews.comments: I got the vibrant green shade over a year ago and it is not dried out which is a great plus for a liquid shawdow. The color does not fade but will crease if you use too mich product. Start with less and add more for tye best result. Overall i love this liquid eyeshadow.

reviews.headline: I will purchase again!
reviews.comments: The Freaked color is just the right lavender pink color. Very pretty for brown eyes, does not crease at all.

reviews.headline: Minty Fresh
reviews.comments: Gorgeous mint shade

faceoff_positive.comments: Heads up: Long review, but it's justified.    So I was initially hesitant to try this brand in general as most celebrity brands are a bit inconsistent in terms of quality. But after a long while of waiting and coming into Pride month, I really wanted to immerse myself in more LGBTQ+ beauty brands and realizing that I still hadn't tried About-Face, I ordered one of the eye paints to give it a go.    Needless to say, this is quite possibly my favorite liquid shadow formula EVER. Simple packaging, easy to apply and doesn't move once she sets. The first shade that I tried was Freaked and while the first layer might look light, it's beyond buildable. The color becomes more and more prominent and for a lavender that's almost muted, the pigment was nuts.    Realizing that I'd struck gold, I immediately ran onto this website and bought more. I was curious to try something more bold, but versatile to different looks. I decided to go with Taxi Driver and Art of Darkness; two ends of the spectrum that could be polarizing and that sounded divine as a makeup lover.   Taxi Driver is a true mango shade. The shots that they use on the website are a tad misleading in terms of how dark the actual shade is, but that's not to discount how absolutely stunning it is. I could imagine this would look beautiful on its own (and I do plan to do that as well), but adding a shimmer on top of this is just excellent.   And for Art of Darkness, this is the most sickening black liquid shadow I've interacted with that wasn't just me playing with eyeliner. It can make a gorgeous, dark look with vampy, gothic vibes or you can create an cat-eye sharp enough to cut diamonds.    Also buy the liner brush that's on here too. I need to review that also, but it works wonderfully to create that perfect cat eye.   The one downside that I see to this is it's accessibility in terms of what type of MUA will gravitate toward this type of product. You really need to work quick as it dries within seconds, so someone who's a little less experienced or new to makeup might have a hard time. I also had a little bit of an issue combining with any powder formulas. Which isn't really an issue if you're solely using About-Face products, but with how amazing this product is, I was hoping it would be a little more flexible in that regard.   To wrap it all up, if you're thinking of buying these and you love makeup, just do it. There's such a range of shades and the price is SO affordable that it makes sense to pick up a couple. I'm probably going to own the whole range within the next few months, so I can't wait to experience the full rainbow.   Thanks About-Face. Gave me more confidence that a true artist is behind the product.
faceoff_positive.headline: Absolutely Obsessed!

faceoff_negative.comments: Let me first say I'm IN LOVE with the products. They stay, they're pigmented, they're easy to blend, a little goes a LONG way so you get your money's worth. I'm giving a side by side of before and after a rock concert where I was headbanging, drinking, sweating, yelling, singing, the works. I've got eye paint and a lip duo on and although you can't see much of the shadow, let me assure you, it didn't move. The corners of my lips are the only places that smudged but that comes from sweat and drinks - but it's still VERY MUCH there where I would've had to reapply other lip colors a few times during a concert.    My struggle comes from the customer service. I've had a couple orders now where I've been allowed to buy product(s) that are sold out but not listed as sold out on the website. One particular order I placed on 4/19, and after a week or not being updated about shipping reached out and was told it wasn't sent out because one of the products was sold out. No one reached out to me, no one said anything until I asked. The rep was sweet and offered to have me swap it for something else, but when it didn't ship after several more days, I reached out again and was told ANOTHER item wasn't available and I was being given a refund (mind you, it's been over a business week at this point and I would've been given this item had my shipment been corrected immediately). I still have not received this order and had originally placed it for the concert I was going to in these photos. What bothers me the most about all of this; the item I was given a refund for is currently listed as available despite me being told only a couple days ago that it was out of stock. I requested to be told when the shade was back in stock and have received no email leading me to believe it wasn't ever listed as unavailable or was always in stock to begin with.    The products are amazing and I love them especially for the price, but the run around with all of this is extremely frustrating. The answers I've been given have felt fluffy, I've had lack of information or clarification when asking for further information, and responses have very much been 'I'm sorry you're dealing with this but it'll be on the way soon' which - to be honest - makes it seem like they don't care much.
faceoff_negative.headline: Love the product, customer service brought it down
